Author: TheMilkierMan
Text: Usually when thinking about other people, there's a separation of emotion and logic, meaning that you can think objectively. With yourself, that line between emotion and logic can become blurred, which doesn't mean that you're a bad person for thinking of yourself as fat when your friends are heavier than you, just that it's often quite difficult to think about yourself objectively (not to mention that a lot of us tend to like our friends better than we like ourselves). Don't be so hard on yourself

Author: lisa_matsuki
Text: Don’t feel guilty about it because that feeling is an unfortunate side effect of your ED. Feeling more emotional may not seem justified, but it is completely, because you’re distressed and stressed regardless of the physical reality of it.
